and can be refernced by theme/them-name/path/file.ff
even though they are located at VAADIN/static
Fixes #9405
Fixes #9535

commit.message: Fix serving of resources in devMode

nodes.bodyText: This pattern "^\\/theme\\/[\\s\\S]*?\\/" matches /theme//. Would it be better to use + instead of * in order to exclude empty theme folder name?
Add a line break before ||, line length > 80
Why did you exclude if(urlResource.match(themePartRegex)){ ... }? I presume that excluding the frontend/ is not needed anymore, but the resourcePath can still have no node_modules inside, right?
Same question as above: shall it be [\S]+, not [\S]*?

commit.message:
Fix naming and formatting.

Change regexes to require at
least one group for the file-/folderName.

nodes.bodyText:
As we want to have the resource in theme/theme-name we get it from the [path][name].[ext] but for node modules we don't want it to be in node_modules\.pnpm\registry.npmjs.org\@fortawesome\fontawesome-free\5.15.1\node_modules\@fortawesome\fontawesome-free\webfonts\fa-regular-400.eot but rather @fortawesome\fontawesome-free\webfonts\fa-regular-400.eot
Also using urlResource for checking node was wrong as it made the string ules\.pnpm\registry.npmjs.org\@fortawesome\fontawesome-free\5.15.1\node_modules\@fortawesome\fontawesome-free\webfonts\fa-brands-400.eot as the node_modules folder is not below frontend.
Doesn't matter in this instance as we always should target a file for node_modules. but I can change it
Named APP_THEME_PATTERN as its not for theme folder per say.
